snippet: For years there have been questions about Tim Duncan’s true position with the Spurs, but it’s safe to say that he would not have objected to being called a point guard if that would have assured him the fifth championship ring of his career.
abstract: Harvey Araton Off the Dribble column observes that one day Tim Duncan of the San Antonio Spurs will be remembered as either the greatest power forward in league history, or one of its most distinguished centers; regardless of how history sees Duncan, he is one of his generation’s very best players, who can’t be categorically fit into any assigned place.
lead_paragraph: For years there have been questions about Tim Duncan’s true position with the Spurs, but it’s safe to say that he would not have objected to being called a point guard if that would have assured him the fifth championship ring of his career.

headline.main: Labels Don’t Fit Duncan, but Championship Rings Do
headline.print_headline: Labels Don’t Fit Duncan, But His Rings Do
